developments and business strategies.</font></p>

statements in this annual report on Form 10-K after the date of this filing, except as may be required by law.&nbsp; In light of these risks and uncertainties, you should keep in mind that any forward&#8209;looking statement made in this Annual Report on Form 10-K or
elsewhere might not occur.</font></p>

<p align="center"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman"><br />

<div align="center"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font>
<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#999999" align="center" />
</div>

<p align="center"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">PART I</font></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><a name="i1"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">ITEM 1.&nbsp;BUSINESS</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><a name="tx14120_1"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Overview</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In this Annual Report on Form 10-K, we use the terms &ldquo;KFx,&rdquo; &ldquo;we,&rdquo; &ldquo;our,&rdquo; and &ldquo;us&rdquo; to
refer to KFx Inc. and its subsidiaries.&nbsp; All references to K-Fuel and K-Fuel&trade;<font color="black">refer to our patented process and technology explained in detail throughout this Annual Report on Form 10-K.&nbsp; All references to years, unless otherwise
noted, refer to our fiscal year, which ends on December 31st.</font></font></p>

<p><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font> <font size="2">We offer combined energy, environmental and economic solutions to coal-fired power generating
facilities and industrial coal users in the United States and internationally.&nbsp; Our proprietary K-Fuel process uses heat and pressure to physically and chemically transform high moisture, low-Btu coals, such as subbituminous coal and lignite, into a more energy
efficient, lower&#8209;emission fuel.&nbsp; A co-benefit of the K-Fuel process is the removal of significant amounts of impurities, including mercury, and the reduction of emissions of sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Throughout the United States and internationally, there are abundant reserves of high moisture, low-Btu coals with heat values of less
than 9,000 Btus.&nbsp; However, many coal-fired power generating facilities burn coal that is 11,000 Btus or greater.&nbsp; The K-Fuel process applies heat and pressure to Powder River Basin, or PRB, coal with a high water content to reduce moisture from
approximately 30% in the low-Btu coal to 8% to 12% in the K-Fuel products.&nbsp; As a result, the heat value is boosted by 30% to 40%, resulting in its increased efficiency for use in power generating facilities.&nbsp; Further, the K-Fuel process removes a
significant amount of impurities from the low-Btu coal allowing for the power generating industry to more economically comply with increasingly stringent air emission standards and environmental regulations.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><a name="OLE_LINK3"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We have substantially completed the construction of our 750,000-tons per year K-Fuel plant and mine project in
Wyoming's Powder River Basin, which is our first commercial plant implementing the K-Fuel process.</font></a><font size="2">&nbsp; In December&nbsp;2005, we completed our first two production runs using feedstock coal with less than 8,000 Btus at the 750,000-tons per
year plant.&nbsp; The initial production runs resulted in a product that was approximately 11,000 Btus, with a moisture content of between 8% and 12%, meeting our desired specifications for K-Fuel product.&nbsp; Further, the initial product showed the predicted
reduction in mercury of approximately 70% from the feedstock coal.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We were founded in 1984 as a clean coal company focused on developing our K-Fuel process.&nbsp; <font color="black">We incorporated
under the laws of the state of Delaware in 1988.&nbsp; Our principal exec</font><font color="black">utive offices are located at 55 Madison Street, Suite 500, Denver, Colorado 80206, and our telephone number is (303) 293-2992.</font></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></b></h5>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Business Strategy</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The principal elements of our business strategy are to construct additional K-Fuel facilities thus&nbsp; increasing the&nbsp;
production of K-Fuel product, and generate earnings and cash flows.&nbsp; We plan to focus on the following:</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Expand Production through the Construction of K-Fuel Facilities.</font></i>&nbsp; <font size="2">We intend to construct K-Fuel facilities at coal mine sites to process abundant reserves of cheap subbituminous coal and
lignite into K-Fuel products.&nbsp; We are also exploring the potential for integrating the construction of K-Fuel plants at new and existing power generating facilities.&nbsp; We have substantially completed our 750,000-tons per year K-Fuel plant in the Powder River
Basin, and have signed agreements for the development of future K-Fuel plants also located in the Powder River Basin.&nbsp; We have also signed a memorandum of understanding with a coal producer to access their mine site location in Louisiana to determine the
viability of a K-Fuel plant using lignite at that location.&nbsp; We will continue to pursue increased production through investigation of potential sites for the construction of new facilities, both within the Powder River Basin and throughout other coal-producing
regions of the United States, focusing on sites that have readily available access to rail and barge transportation.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Continue to Pursue Vertical Integration through Acquisitions and Joint Ventures.</font></i> <font size="2">&nbsp; We believe we are well-positioned to pursue selected acquisitions and attract industry joint venture partners
to continue our vertical integration strategy.&nbsp; In 2005, we acquired a research and engineering firm focused on thermal process engineering, including the upgrading and processing of coal.&nbsp; Further, we have entered into a stock purchase agreement with the
parent company of Buckeye Industrial Mining Co. to purchase all of the outstanding stock of Buckeye, which would provide us with established markets, infrastructure, blending facilities, coal supply, and operating cash flow.&nbsp; We expect to pursue additional
acquisitions of companies with coal resources and businesses complementary to our business model and strategy.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>
</table>

<p align="center"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">3</font></p>

<div align="center"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font>
<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#999999" align="center" />
</div>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Enter into Licensing Agreements</font></i>.&nbsp; <font size="2">We plan to develop and operate K-Fuel production plants domestically and internationally through licensing our K-Fuel technology to third parties.&nbsp; We
believe that there are a number of opportunities to license our technology to operators in other regions that have access to deep-water ports and high moisture, low-Btu coal supplies.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Competitive Strengths</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As a result of the following strengths, we believe we are well positioned to execute our business strategy:</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Technical Expertise</font></i>.&nbsp; <font size="2">Our strategic alliance with Lurgi South Africa Technology Company has brought over 70 years of experience in designing and building coal processing plants for the
implementation of the K-Fuel process.&nbsp; In addition to our strategic alliance, we acquired a research and engineering firm focused on thermal process engineering, including the upgrading and processing of coal.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Proprietary Process</font></i>. <font size="2">&nbsp; Our proprietary commercial beneficiation process affords a number of advantages over competing technologies such as gasification and liquefaction.&nbsp; The K-Fuel
process incorporates proven Lurgi South Africa commercial equipment, which has been utilized in similar applications throughout the world.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Favorable Price Differentials and Tax Credits</font></i>.&nbsp; <font size="2">We have uniquely positioned our self in the energy market to capture a potion of the price differential between high -and low-Btu coals.&nbsp;
In addition, we believe IRS Section&nbsp;45 clean coal production tax credits are available for coal processed in our&nbsp; facilities placed in service prior to January&nbsp;1, 2009.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Lower Emissions and Environmental Benefits.</font></i> <font size="2">&nbsp; In addition to the economic advantages associated with capturing the price differential between high - and low-Btu coals, the K-Fuel process
removes a significant amount of impurities from the low-Btu coals, assisting the power generating industry in economically complying with increasingly stringent air emission standards and environmental regulations.&nbsp; Power generating facilities burning K-Fuel
should realize lower emissions, and, therefore, experience significant savings as a result of not having to purchase sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxide and mercury credits.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Recent Developments</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b> <i>&nbsp;Buckeye</i> <i>Acquisition</i></h5>

<p><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></i></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On March&nbsp;6, 2006, we entered into a stock purchase agreement with Keller Group,&nbsp;Inc. to acquire its wholly owned subsidiary,
Buckeye Industrial Mining Co. Buckeye's primary business is to mine, process and sell coal to power generating facilities and industrial users.&nbsp; The total purchase price of $37.5&nbsp;million consists of our common stock valued at $2.5&nbsp;million and
$35&nbsp;million in cash.&nbsp; We expect to close in early April 2006.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The contemplated acquisition of Buckeye continues our vertical integration strategy.&nbsp; The expected benefits of the acquisition
would provide us with established markets, infrastructure, blending facilities, coal supply, and operating cash flow</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b> <i>&nbsp;Follow-On Common Stock Offering</i></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><a name="OLE_LINK5"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On February&nbsp;8, 2006, we sold 7 million shares of common stock at a price to the public of $18.75&nbsp;per
share pursuant to a follow-on common stock offering.&nbsp; On February 27, 2006, the underwriters exercised in full their over allotment option, purchasing an additional 1.1 million shares of common stock.&nbsp; Including the over-allotment, the offering totaled 8.1
million shares of common stock at a price of $18.75, resulting in net proceeds of approximately $144.4 million after deducting the underwriting discounts and commissions and estimated offering expenses.&nbsp; We plan to use the proceeds from this offering to fund the
contemplated acquisition of Buckeye, new plant facility construction costs, the purchase of a coal-fired boiler and general corporate purposes.&nbsp; If we are unable to close the acquisition of Buckeye, we intend to use those funds to further the development of our
K-Fuel plants and for any acquisitions we may identify in the future.</font></a></p>



<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></i></b> Operations and Business History</h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Historically, we have reported results for our business in one segment.&nbsp; However, in December 2004, we entered into an agreement
to license our proprietary coal processing technology.&nbsp; Due to this licensing agreement we now operate our business in two segments, the Licensing segment and the Operating segment.&nbsp; The Licensing segment represents&nbsp;revenue and costs related to the
licensing of our technology to third parties and comprised virtually all our revenue in 2005 and 2004.&nbsp; The Operating segment contains all other operations including:</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

</div>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As our operations expand, we will continue to evaluate how we manage and report our business and expect to increase the number of
segments.&nbsp; Since we operated our business in a single segment in prior years, our discussion is focused on our overall business history and strategy, rather than by segment, unless otherwise indicated.&nbsp;</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b> Patents</h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Over the past 20 years, we have obtained multiple patents for different versions of the K-Fuel technology using a variety of methods to
apply heat and pressure to beneficiate high moisture coal feedstocks.&nbsp; We have patents or patent applications for the K-Fuel technology issued or pending in the United States and in over 40 foreign countries.&nbsp; As we continue to develop and make enhancements
to K-Fuel, we intend to continue to file for additional patent protection.&nbsp;</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The following historical events have contributed to the development and improvement of our technology:</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">On January 2, 2003, we signed an exclusive business development and intellectual property rights agreement with Lurgi South Africa to combine the K-Fuel process with Lurgi South Africa&rsquo;s technical services and
equipment.</font></p>

coal) build-up within the system during production and product quality issues related to product dusting.&nbsp; Through modifications to our process, we believe we have resolved these issues in the K-Fuel process.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; During the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, our research and development costs were approximately $1.6 million, $696,000
and $1.6 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b> Acquisitions</h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Effective March 1, 2005, we acquired MR&amp;E LLC, a research and engineering firm focused on thermal process engineering, including
the upgrading and processing of clean coal.&nbsp; We acquired all of the outstanding membership interests for cash of $656,000.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On May&nbsp;21, 2004, we acquired all of the outstanding stock of Landrica Development Company from Wyodak Resources Development
Corporation for cash of $523,000 and assumption of an asset retirement obligation of $2.7 million.&nbsp; Landrica owns a coal mine facility in Cambell County, Wyoming with assets that include 1,000 acres of land, buildings, coal handling equipment, a railroad loop
and other pieces of mining equipment and property.&nbsp; We have located our 750,000-tons per year plant on this site and believe that owning the land on which the 750,000-tons per year plant is located will provide us with operational efficiencies in the
future.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Discontinued Operations</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On November 26, 2003, we completed an equity exchange transaction with Kennecott Energy Company.&nbsp; In accordance with the terms,
Kennecott transferred to KFx its 49% membership interest in K-Fuel, LLC, or KFL, and the full ownership of all related technology and patents developed by Kennecott.&nbsp; Prior to the consummation of this transaction, KFx owned a 51% membership interest in KFL
..&nbsp; In exchange, KFx transferred its ownership interests in Pegasus Technologies Inc. to Kennecott.&nbsp; KFx had previously held approximately 65% ownership in Pegasus.&nbsp; As a part of this transaction, Kennecott also received a license and all necessary
rights to build and operate up to three commercial K-Fuel plants and to market K-Fuel or other production from those plants.&nbsp; Each plant can have annual capacity of up to three million tons and Kennecott will pay applicable royalty and license fees for these
three plants.&nbsp;</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p align="center"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">5</font></p>

<div align="center"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font>
<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#999999" align="center" />
</div>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Competition</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; K-Fuel is an upgraded coal characterized by low-moisture, high-Btu content and low sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides and mercury
emissions.&nbsp; As such, the known direct competitors for K-Fuel include other coal upgrading processes, other high Btu coal, low sulfur coal and clean coal technology companies that produce equipment to reduce emissions from the burning of coal.&nbsp; The indirect
competition to K-Fuel includes electrical generation from natural gas, nuclear fuel, oil, wind, bio-fuels, and other renewable energy sources.&nbsp; Over the past two years, pricing trends for a number of these alternatives have enhanced the competitive position of
K-Fuel.&nbsp;</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Potential customers could choose to install pollution equipment instead of using K-Fuel and /or choose to inject additives to reduce
emissions.&nbsp; This equipment includes low-nitrogen oxide burners, over-fire air systems, selective catalytic reduction systems, sulfur scrubbers, fabric filters, electrostatic precipitators, mercury control technology, or other equipment.&nbsp; In contrast to
K-Fuel, most of these technologies require a significant investment of funds by the customer and impose a parasitic load on the plant, thereby reducing the salable electricity produced from the affected unit.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Environmental Regulation Affecting our Market</font></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We believe that existing and proposed legislation&nbsp; regulations could impact fossil fuel-fired, and specifically coal-fired, power
generating facilities.&nbsp; According to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (&ldquo;EPA&rdquo;), power generation emits substantial levels of sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides and mercury into the environment<font color="black">.&nbsp; Regulation of these
emissions</font> can affect the market for our K-Fuel product by imposing limits and caps on these emissions.&nbsp; The most significant legislation and regulations affecting our market include: the Clean Air Act, the Clean Air Interstate Rule and the Clean Air
Mercury Rule, which are described further below.&nbsp; In addition, the K-Fuel market could be affected by the Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative, which requires reduction in carbon dioxide starting in 2009 in 7 northeastern states; EPA&rsquo;s Nitrogen Oxide State
Implementation Plan Call, which requires 22 eastern states and the District of Columbia to reduce summertime ozone formation by controlling nitrogen oxide emissions; EPA&rsquo;s National Ambient Air Quality Standards for ozone and fine particulate matter, which
requires that approximately 700 counties across the U.S. achieve attainment of ozone and particulate matter standards; and the Regional Haze Rules which requires emission controls for industrial facilities emitting air pollutants that reduce visibility by causing or
contributing to regional haze.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The following briefly describes the most important laws and regulations affecting the market for our products.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">The Clean Air Act and Acid Rain Program.</font></b>&nbsp; <font size="2">The Clean Air Act of 1970, as amended (&ldquo;CAA&rdquo;) is the primary mechanism for regulating emissions of <font color="black">sulfur dioxide and
nitrogen oxide from</font> coal-fired power generating facilities<font color="black">.&nbsp; A key component of the CAA regulates sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxide emissions.&nbsp; Specifically, title IV of the CAA set a goal of reducing SO2 emissions by 10 million
tons below 1980 levels and imposed a two-phased tightening of restrictions on fossil fuel-fired power plants.&nbsp; Phase I began in 1995 and focused primarily on coal-burning electric utility plants in the east and midwest.&nbsp; In 2000, Phase II began and this
phase tightened the annual emissions&rsquo; limits on larger higher emitting plants and set restrictions on smaller, cleaner plants fired by coal, oil, and gas.&nbsp; The Acid Rain Program also calls for a 2 million ton reduction in NOx emission and focuses on one
set of sources that emit NOx: coal-fired electric utility boilers.&nbsp; Beginning in January 2000, NOx emissions are to be reduced 900,000 tons per year beyond the 1.2 million per year reduction set by the EPS in 1995.&nbsp;</font></font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Clean Air Interstate Rule.</font></b><font size="2">&nbsp; The Clean Air Interstate Rule (&ldquo;CAIR&rdquo;) was proposed by EPA in January 2004.&nbsp; Once fully implemented, CAIR will reduce SO2 emissions in 28 states
and D.C. by more than 70% and NOx emissions by more than 60% from the 2003 levels.&nbsp; Through the use of a cap-and-trade approach, CAIR promises to achieve substantial reduction of SO2 and NOx emissions.&nbsp; Implementation of CAIR begins in 2006 with revised
State Implementation Plans (SIPs).&nbsp; The rule will be fully implemented by 2015.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Clean Air Mercury Rule.</font></b> <font size="2">&nbsp; The Clean Air Mercury Rule (&ldquo;CAMR&rdquo;) will impose mandatory mercury emissions reduction on electric utility coal-fired power plants for the first
time.&nbsp; EPA finalized CAMR on May 18, 2005, but agreed on October 21, 2005 to reconsider certain portions of the rule.&nbsp; EPA is responding to petitions for reconsidering submitted by several states, environmental groups and Indian Tribes.&nbsp; EPA&rsquo;s
CAMR is based on EPA&rsquo;s finding that approximately 75 tons of mercury are found in coal delivered to power plants each year and about 2/3 of this mercury is emitted to the air.&nbsp; As current formulated, CAMR allows coal-fired power plants to cap emissions in
two phases, in 2010 and 2018, and trade mercury allowances.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p align="center"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">6</font></p>

<div align="center"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font>
<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#999999" align="center" />
</div>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Environmental Regulation Affecting the Construction and Operation of our Plants</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As a general matter, we are subject to a number of state and federal regulations that (i) seek to limit the amounts of certain
emissions into the environment; (ii) regulate the disposal of certain potentially hazardous materials; and (iii) impose certain employee safety requirements upon us.&nbsp; While the coal mining and electric power generation industries are subject to significant
regulation, we believe that our exposure to such regulation is limited because of the current nature of our operations.&nbsp; However, as we expand our operations we may become subject to more regulation.&nbsp; For example, if we build additional plants we may
install coal-fired boilers, which are subject to more permitting requirements and more environmental regulation than gas-fired boilers.&nbsp; Further, as we begin to mine coal from our open pit and if we complete the Buckeye acquisition, we will be subject to
additional regulations including the Coal Mine Health and Safety Act of 1969, the Federal Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977, the Black Lung Benefits Revenue Act of 1977 and other regulations that seek to protect the health and safety of employees.&nbsp;</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In the United States, the K-Fuel product is not expected to be subject to unusual levels of local, state or federal regulation with
respect to its transportation and distribution.&nbsp; However, any future U.S. production plants will require numerous permits, approvals and certificates from appropriate federal, state and local governmental agencies before construction of each facility can begin
and will be required to comply with applicable environmental laws and regulations (including obtaining operating permits) once facilities begin production.&nbsp; The most significant types of permits that are typically required for commercial production facilities
include an operating and construction permit under the CAA, a wastewater discharge permit under the Clean Water Act, and a treatment, storage and disposal permit under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.&nbsp; Some of the federal programs have delegated
regulatory authority to the states and, as a result, facilities may be required to secure state permits.&nbsp; Finally, the construction of new facilities may require review under the National Environmental Policy Act, or NEPA, or a state equivalent, which requires
analysis of environmental impacts and, potentially, the implementation of measures to avoid or minimize these environmental impacts.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Any international K-Fuel production plants will also be subject to various permitting and operational regulations specific to each
country.&nbsp; International initiatives, such as the Kyoto Protocol, are expected to create increasing pressures on the electric power generation industry on a world-wide basis to reduce emissions of various pollutants, which management expects will create
additional demand for our products and services.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In 2004, Congress passed tax credits for refined coal within the American Jobs Creation Act.&nbsp; To qualify for the tax credit, the
refined coal must realize a reduction of at least 20% in nitrogen oxide emissions and at least 20% in either sulfur dioxide or mercury emissions and have an increase in market value over the comparable coal of at least 50%.&nbsp; Based upon our testing to date, we
believe that K-Fuel meets these requirements and that our future K-Fuel production plants will be eligible for the credit if they are operational by January 1, 2009.&nbsp; Generally, the refined coal credit, escalated annually, will be earned for each ton produced
over a ten-year period from the date the plant is placed in service.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Employees</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; At January 31, 2006, we had 72 full-time employees.&nbsp;</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Access to Information</font></b></p>

<p><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Our web site address is www.kfx.com.&nbsp; We make available, free of charge, on the Investor Info section of our web site our Annual
Report on Form 10-K, Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q, Current Reports on Form 8-K, and all amendments to those reports, as soon as reasonably practicable after these reports are electronically filed with or furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission.&nbsp; We
also make available through our web site other reports electronically filed with the SEC under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, including our proxy statements and reports filed by officers and directors under Section 16(a) of that Act.&nbsp; We do not intend for
information contained in our web site to be part of this Annual Report on Form 10-K</font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></b></h5>

<h5><a name="i1a"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">ITEM 1A.&nbsp; RISK FACTORS</font></b></h5>

<p><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In addition to risk and uncertainties in the ordinary course of business that are common to all businesses, important factors that are
specific to our industry and our company could materially impact our future performance and results.&nbsp; We have provided below a list of these risks factors that should be reviewed when considering our business and securities.&nbsp; These are not all the risks we
face, and other factors currently considered immaterial or unknown to us may impact our future operations.</font></p>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></b></h5>

<p align="center"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">7</font></p>

<div align="center"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font>
<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#999999" align="center" />
</div>

<h5><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Business Risks</font></b></h5>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">We have a history of losses, deficits, and negative operating cash flows and will likely continue to incur losses in the future.</font></i></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We expect to incur operating losses and continued negative cash flows from operations for the foreseeable future.&nbsp; We have made,
and will continue to make, substantial capital and other expenditures before we will have sufficient operating income and cash flow to recover our investments.&nbsp; We are not able to accurately estimate when, if ever, our operating income will increase sufficiently
to cover these investments.&nbsp; Further, we may not achieve or maintain profitability or generate cash from operations in future periods.&nbsp; Our working capital (the amount our current assets exceed our current liabilities), accumulated deficit, net loss and
cash (used in) provided by operating activities are as follows:</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">We have substantial capital requirements and, as a result, we have been and continue to be dependent on sales of our equity securities to fund our operating costs.</font></i></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As a result of negative cash flows from operations, we have been and continue to be dependent on sales of our equity securities to fund
the operating and substantial capital costs associated with our business.&nbsp; Our business strategy may further increase our needs for additional capital.&nbsp; Our success is dependent on our ability to utilize existing resources and to generate sufficient cash
flows to meet our obligations on a timely basis, to obtain financing or refinancing as may be required, to attain profitability, or a combination thereof.&nbsp; Depending on our future operations and the conditions of the equity capital markets, we may not be able to
continue to raise additional equity capital on terms acceptable to us or at all.&nbsp; A lack of adequate financing may adversely affect our ability to pursue our business strategy, respond to changing business and economic conditions and competitive pressures,
absorb negative operating results and fund our continuing operations, capital expenditures or increased working capital requirements.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">We have a limited operating history as an energy solutions company, and our business and prospects should be considered in light of the risks and difficulties typically encountered by a company with a limited operating
history.</font></i></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You should consider our business and prospects in light of the risks and difficulties typically encountered by a company with a limited
operating history.&nbsp; The specific risks include whether we will be able to:</font></p>

</div>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We may not be successful in addressing these and other risks.&nbsp; As a result, our financial condition and results of operations may
be adversely affected.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Technical and operational problems may adversely impact our ability to operate or develop K-Fuel facilities, resulting in delays in the production of our K-Fuel products.</font></i></b></p>

<p><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></i></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Problems we may encounter in current and future plants include:</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">construction problems including cost overruns, delays, damage, technical issues, availability of raw material, availability of workers or contractors and weather;</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">

</td>

<td valign="top">

</td>

</td>

</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">products produced may not meet our specifications or customer requirements.</font></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Our ability to effectively operate and develop K-Fuel facilities may be harmed to the extent these and other technical or operational
problems materialize.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Any negative results from the continuing evaluation of K-Fuel produced at our 750,000- tons per year plant site or future plant sites by us or third parties could have a material adverse effect on the marketability of
K-Fuel and our future prospects.</font></i></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We and certain third parties are continuing to evaluate K-Fuel produced at test runs conducted at our 750,000-tons per year plant
site.&nbsp; There can be no assurance that this evaluation will&nbsp; result in positive findings concerning the moisture content, heat value, emission&#8209;levels, burn qualities or other aspects of our K-Fuel product.&nbsp; Furthermore, even should this initial
evaluation indicate that our K-Fuel product performs to design specifications, there can be no assurance that later tests will confirm these preliminary results or that our K-Fuel product will be readily accepted by the market.&nbsp; The process of introducing K-Fuel
into the market may be further delayed if these test results are negative or if potential customers conduct their own tests of the K-Fuel product to determine whether it meets their individual requirements.&nbsp; If this continuing process of evaluation and market
introduction results in negative findings concerning the K-Fuel process, this could have a material adverse effect on the marketability of K-Fuel and on our financial condition, results of operations and future prospects.</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">Due to the uncertain market for, and commercial acceptance of, our K&#8209;Fuel products, we may not be able to realize significant revenues from the sale of K-Fuel products.</font></i></b></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; While we believe that a commercial market will develop both domestically and internationally for cleaner coal products such as K-Fuel,
we will face the following risks due to the developing market for our cleaner coal technology:</font></p>

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"></font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">limited pricing information;</font></p>
</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">
<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>
</td>
<td valign="top"></td>
<td valign="top"></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td valign="top">

<p><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">changes in the price differential between low- and high-Btu coal;</font></p>
</td>

</td>
